Author: chaostheory
Content:
I forget what the research was called or who it was done by, but there's another magic number: 8.

Once a group/faction grows beyond that number, sub-factions within the group begin forming....

Author: tx
Content:
5 requests/second is "good life average"? While he certainly deserves a credit for trying to shoot conservatively, but such low numbers will only scare more people away.

Our slowest requests (with multiple SQL queries and nontrivial rhtml rendering) get served @25-30req/sec, while "regular", i.e. not heavy requests are served @60-120req/sec and we're certainly not "Rails sharks" having less than a year of real life experience and our server is a $850 Opteron box.

Title: Submit Your Code To Be Refactored

Author: tokipin
Content:
can't say i'm convinced of the web-based future of applications myself. the idea strikes me as very mainframey. i'm sure the potential is there, but a rebirth of some sort might be necessary

in particular, i don't see the benefit of web-based apps vs traditional desktop ones. there's a few, such as the centralization of files, but they seem pretty negligible. it's possible web-based apps have been conceptually intermingled with web 2.0

either way, Microsoft isn't exactly sitting around, having just released Silverlight

Author: steveplace
Content:
"When will we see a female version of Steve Jobs or Warren Buffet or even Seth Godin? "

Oprah comes to mind. Sure, her industry is not tech or finance or whatever seth godin can be pigeonholed into, but she's there and a leader in her field.

Author: axod
Content: Problem is most PCs that come with windows, also come with the manufacturers own selection of 'shady programs', trials, adware, etc etc designed to make them some extra money.

Author: jamongkad
Content: Very nice convey my thanks also.

Author: wyday
Content:
Don't install shady programs and, like I said, a defrag will suffice. If you do however install a bunch of junk then you'll need to reinstall Windows.

The same would be true for any other OS that is filled with malicious programs; that is, it's easier to start over than to remove the junk one-by-one.
